schema.name: risk_schema
schema.introduction:
This part of ISO 10303 identifies a by specifying the outcome or consequence of an event and the associated probability for the occurrence of this event. Details of risk analysis such as modelling of accident development or detailed consequence calculations are not included in the risk_schema The ISO/IEC Guide 73 Risk management - Vocabulary - Guidelines for use in standards, is the basis for definitions and concept used in this part of ISO 10303.
Risk is managed in different ways by organizations of all types. The standard ISO 31000 Risk management-Principles and guidelines, establishes a number of principles that need to be satisfied to make risk management effective. This part of ISO 10303 describes a data structure that can represent both risk management processes and the outcomes from the risk management activities.
A risk describes the concern at hand which may be related to more than one event with more than one possible outcome or consequence.
Risk is always present and more than one perception of a risk is possible. The representation of a these perceptions are described as in a particular context along with the probability of an event and its corresponding consequence or consequences.
The specifies risk sources, i.e. items or activities having a potential for consequences that might be subject to further analysis and assessment.
A source of is not limited to events but may apply to products, people, organizations, or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this Integrated resource part.
Providing meaningful value of an assessment requires that a comparison is made between estimated risk probability and the corresponding consequences, and the estimate of the criterias that define an acceptable risk status. Both the estimated values of criterias and the status of the risk can change. The allows several perceptions of the risk to be recorded and to be compared.

fund_cons.p: A can be determinately identified by a set of recognisable assessments or perceptions that can be used to distinguish all relevant possible outcomes.
In this part of ISO 10303 such a perception is recorded as an instance of the entity.
fund_cons.note: A is susceptible to reassessment over time. The assigns a stage for such assessments.
fund_cons.p:
